Welcome to Contact project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async src.main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If it doesn’t, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.main.index()¶
The index function returns a dictionary with the message &quot;Contact Application&quot;
return:

{&quot;message&quot;: &quot;Contact Application&quot;}

Returns:

A dictionary that contains a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

The lifespan function is a function that will be called when the application starts up, and it will also be called when the application shuts down. It’s useful for setting up resources that need to exist for as long as your application is running. In this case, we’re using it to create a connection pool to our Redis server.

Parameters:

app – FastAPI: Pass the fastapi object to the function

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a function that can be paused and resumed

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository CONTACTS¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body and convert it to a contact object

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

The contact object, which is a sqlalchemy model

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object, which is a row from the contacts table

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of rows to skip before returning results

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(db: AsyncSession, query: str)¶

The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • query – str: Search for contacts by first name, last name or email

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to update

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object if it exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The newly created user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on an email address.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session, which is used to execute sql queries

Returns:

A single user or none if no user is found

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh token for a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that will be used to retrieve a contact

  • ge – Validate the input

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • le – Limit the maximum number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first contact to return

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user, which is used to filter out contacts that are not

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that are to be updated. If any field is not provided, it will not be changed.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The updated contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Doc-author:

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that returns the current user. It uses the auth_service to get the current user from cache or database, and then returns it.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: The current user :doc-author: Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we return an error message. If they do exist but their account has already been confirmed, we return a success message saying so. Otherwise (if they exist and their account has not yet been confirmed), we update their record in our database

by setting &quot;confirmed&quot; to True for that particular record.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests against protected endpoints.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of bearer.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

A dict with the access token, refresh token and the type of token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is a view function that takes in the username of the user who opened your email, the response object from Mailgun’s webhook, and an optional database session. It then prints out a message to your console letting you know that someone has opened your email. Finally it returns an image file to Mailgun to let them know everything went well.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who opened your email

  • response – Response: Return a response to the client

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A png image

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The new user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a JWT token that contains the data passed to it. The function also takes an optional expires_delta parameter, which is a datetime.timedelta object representing the amount of time for which this token will be valid.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – timedelta: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token that is used to verify the user’s email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (timedelta, optional): The time until expiration of the refresh token. Defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id and username to the function

  • expires_delta – timedelta: Set the time that a refresh token is valid for

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Pass the token that was sent in the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection from the pool

Returns:

The user object that is stored in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • password – str: Set the password for a user

Returns:

A string that is the hashed version of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Compare the password that is entered by the user to a hashed version of it

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with a plain text password

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:
-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a recipient for the message and also as part of

the token verification payload. This parameter must be of type EmailStr (a custom class from pydantic) so that it can be validated before being passed into this function. If validation fails, then an error will be raised by pydantic.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
